pull.title: test: add block height test to listsinceblock.py
pull.body:
Follow-up to PR #17437.

Add block height test, expected fields tests, logging, and correct header docstring in `listsinceblock.py`, and improve the release notes.

events.body:
ACK 38e94bc modulo fixing only comment.

I think you can also harden `wallet_reorgsrestore`, `wallet_listtransactions` with block height assertions.
Thanks for the review @ariard. Took your suggestion.
ACK d28907423344a6bafb09ebd422a20cd11ff0cf41, I think 27450e0 could be squashed in ecbd8a2 or d289074.

test: add block height test to listsinceblock.py

and correct the header docstring.

events.body: Updated the release notes commit with @MarcoFalke's suggestion and rebased; no other changes.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,23 +111,25 @@ def test_reorg(self):
         senttx = self.nodes[2].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), 1)
 
         # generate on both sides
-        lastblockhash = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
-        self.nodes[2].generate(7)
-        self.log.info('lastblockhash=%s' % (lastblockhash))
+        lastblockhash_nodes_1 = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
+        lastblockhash_nodes_2 = self.nodes[2].generate(7)[0]

@@ -1,5 +1,6 @@
 Low-level RPC Changes
 ===
 
-- The RPC gettransaction, listtransactions and listsinceblock responses now also
-includes the height of the block that contains the wallet transaction, if any.
+- The RPC gettransaction, listtransactions, and listsinceblock responses now
+include the height of the block that contains the wallet transaction, if any.
+Please refer to the RPC help of these calls for details.

@@ -111,23 +111,25 @@ def test_reorg(self):
         senttx = self.nodes[2].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), 1)
 
         # generate on both sides
-        lastblockhash = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
-        self.nodes[2].generate(7)
-        self.log.info('lastblockhash=%s' % (lastblockhash))
+        lastblockhash_nodes_1 = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
+        lastblockhash_nodes_2 = self.nodes[2].generate(7)[0]

@@ -1,5 +1,6 @@
 Low-level RPC Changes
 ===
 
-- The RPC gettransaction, listtransactions and listsinceblock responses now also
-includes the height of the block that contains the wallet transaction, if any.
+- The RPC gettransaction, listtransactions, and listsinceblock responses now
+include the height of the block that contains the wallet transaction, if any.
+Please refer to the RPC help of these calls for details.
comments.body:
As per @laanwj suggestion in IRC a few months ago: `Release notes should refer to the RPC help for details instead of substituting for full documentation. Example: "Please refer to the RPC help of getbalances for details."`

The commit also fixes a grammar error: s/includes/include/

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,6 @@
 Low-level RPC Changes
 ===
 
-- The RPC gettransaction, listtransactions and listsinceblock responses now also
-includes the height of the block that contains the wallet transaction, if any.
+- The RPC gettransaction, listtransactions, and listsinceblock responses now
+include the height of the block that contains the wallet transaction, if any.
+Please refer to the RPC help of these calls for details.

@@ -108,23 +111,25 @@ def test_reorg(self):
         senttx = self.nodes[2].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), 1)
 
         # generate on both sides
-        lastblockhash = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
-        self.nodes[2].generate(7)
-        self.log.info('lastblockhash=%s' % (lastblockhash))
+        lastblockhash_nodes_1 = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
+        firstblockhash_nodes_2 = self.nodes[2].generate(7)[0]
+        self.log.debug("lastblockhash nodes[1]={}".format(lastblockhash_nodes_1))
+        self.log.debug("firstblockhash nodes[2]={}".format(firstblockhash_nodes_2))
 
         self.sync_all(self.nodes[:2])
         self.sync_all(self.nodes[2:])
 
         self.join_network()
 
-        # listsinceblock(lastblockhash) should now include tx, as seen from nodes[0]
-        lsbres = self.nodes[0].listsinceblock(lastblockhash)
-        found = False
-        for tx in lsbres['transactions']:
+        # listsinceblock(lastblockhash_nodes_1) should now include tx as seen from nodes[0],
+        # and return the block height which listsinceblock now exposes since a5e7795.
+        transactions = self.nodes[0].listsinceblock(lastblockhash_nodes_1)['transactions']
+        for tx in transactions:
             if tx['txid'] == senttx:
-                found = True
+                found = tx
                 break
-        assert found
+        assert_equal(found['blockheight'],
comments.body: This will throw `NameError` if no match is found above? :)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,6 @@
 Low-level RPC Changes
 ===
 
-- The RPC gettransaction, listtransactions and listsinceblock responses now also
-includes the height of the block that contains the wallet transaction, if any.
+- The RPC gettransaction, listtransactions, and listsinceblock responses now
+include the height of the block that contains the wallet transaction, if any.
+Please refer to the RPC help of these calls for details.
comments.body: Maybe instead of mentioning it in every bullet point, once per heading is enough?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -108,23 +111,25 @@ def test_reorg(self):
         senttx = self.nodes[2].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), 1)
 
         # generate on both sides
-        lastblockhash = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
-        self.nodes[2].generate(7)
-        self.log.info('lastblockhash=%s' % (lastblockhash))
+        lastblockhash_nodes_1 = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
+        firstblockhash_nodes_2 = self.nodes[2].generate(7)[0]
+        self.log.debug("lastblockhash nodes[1]={}".format(lastblockhash_nodes_1))
+        self.log.debug("firstblockhash nodes[2]={}".format(firstblockhash_nodes_2))
 
         self.sync_all(self.nodes[:2])
         self.sync_all(self.nodes[2:])
 
         self.join_network()
 
-        # listsinceblock(lastblockhash) should now include tx, as seen from nodes[0]
-        lsbres = self.nodes[0].listsinceblock(lastblockhash)
-        found = False
-        for tx in lsbres['transactions']:
+        # listsinceblock(lastblockhash_nodes_1) should now include tx as seen from nodes[0],
+        # and return the block height which listsinceblock now exposes since a5e7795.
+        transactions = self.nodes[0].listsinceblock(lastblockhash_nodes_1)['transactions']
+        for tx in transactions:
             if tx['txid'] == senttx:
-                found = True
+                found = tx
                 break
-        assert found
+        assert_equal(found['blockheight'],
comments.body: Could add `found = {'blockheight': 0}` if you would prefer it to fail with `AssertionError: not(0 == 103)` instead of `NameError: name 'found' is not defined`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -108,23 +111,25 @@ def test_reorg(self):
         senttx = self.nodes[2].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), 1)
 
         # generate on both sides
-        lastblockhash = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
-        self.nodes[2].generate(7)
-        self.log.info('lastblockhash=%s' % (lastblockhash))
+        lastblockhash_nodes_1 = self.nodes[1].generate(6)[5]
+        firstblockhash_nodes_2 = self.nodes[2].generate(7)[0]
+        self.log.debug("lastblockhash nodes[1]={}".format(lastblockhash_nodes_1))
+        self.log.debug("firstblockhash nodes[2]={}".format(firstblockhash_nodes_2))
 
         self.sync_all(self.nodes[:2])
         self.sync_all(self.nodes[2:])
 
         self.join_network()
 
-        # listsinceblock(lastblockhash) should now include tx, as seen from nodes[0]
-        lsbres = self.nodes[0].listsinceblock(lastblockhash)
-        found = False
-        for tx in lsbres['transactions']:
+        # listsinceblock(lastblockhash_nodes_1) should now include tx as seen from nodes[0],
+        # and return the block height which listsinceblock now exposes since a5e7795.
+        transactions = self.nodes[0].listsinceblock(lastblockhash_nodes_1)['transactions']
+        for tx in transactions:
             if tx['txid'] == senttx:
-                found = True
+                found = tx
                 break
-        assert found
+        assert_equal(found['blockheight'],
comments.body: Perhaps `found = None` and then `assert found is not None` on the line before the `assert_equal`? :)

             if tx['txid'] == senttx:

-        assert found

         # generate on both sides

         self.sync_all(self.nodes[2:])
 
         self.join_network()
 
-        # listsinceblock(lastblockhash) should now include tx, as seen from nodes[0]
-        lsbres = self.nodes[0].listsinceblock(lastblockhash)
-        found = False
-        for tx in lsbres['transactions']:
+        # listsinceblock(lastblockhash_nodes_1) should now include tx as seen from nodes[0],
+        # and return the block height which listsinceblock now exposes since a5e7795.

             if tx['txid'] == senttx:
-                found = True
+                found = tx
                 break
-        assert found
+        assert_equal(found['blockheight'],
comments.body: nit: You can also use `next()`, as we do in other tests.

comments.body:
@MarcoFalke something like this?
```diff
-        found = None
-        for tx in transactions:
-            if tx['txid'] == senttx:
-                found = tx
-                break
-        assert found is not None
+        found = next(tx for tx in transactions if tx['txid'] == senttx)
````

comments.body:
I grew up being taught to not use the Oxford comma, and it could be considered less aesthetic, but it seems to have made a resurgence. It has the benefit of reducing potential confusion in writing that needs to be clear. Without it, meanings of sentences can change. So it can be a good idea to use it for documentation writing. That said, I don't feel strongly about it here :)

https://www.rd.com/culture/oxford-comma-proper-use/
https://thewritelife.com/is-the-oxford-comma-necessary/
https://thewritepractice.com/why-you-need-to-be-using-oxford-commas/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_comma
